channel.title: Remove muPDF and switch xpdf for better security
channel.description:
Remove muPDF and switch [xpdf](https://packages.debian.org/buster/xpdf):
- It has better usability like finding page number , showing scrolling bar , opening file from within the pdf...etc - It has default firejail sandboxing profiles which can be even viewed using firetools - mupdf has [multiple security issues](https://tracker.debian.org/pkg/mupdf) found inside it.
Note: xpdf is DE free and doesnt depend on particular one.

changed 1 files with 1 additions and 1 deletions.

Read full topic

item.title: Remove muPDF and switch xpdf for better security
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
Patrick:

Or we could apply looking at tracker.debian.org when considering new packages for installation by default only.

I see then xpdf is the next best option.

Read full topic
item.source: Remove muPDF and switch xpdf for better security

item.title: Remove muPDF and switch xpdf for better security
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
• https://packages.debian.org/buster/qpdfview
  • https://tracker.debian.org/pkg/qpdfview

ITA: Someone intends to adopt this package. normal

Which then stalled. qpdfview package is currently orphaned, not maintained by any Debian maintainer.

Not sure we should make this a factor or keep ignoring https://tracker.debian.org/pkg/package-name as we do for most packages. If that was to be applied consistently it might reveal a huge mess of actually non-maintained or less than ideally-maintained packages. Might not be manageable to follow these. An option would be to ignore this, hope, and wait for Debian to take action. Or we could apply looking at tracker.debian.org when considering new packages for installation by default only.

Read full topic
item.source: Remove muPDF and switch xpdf for better security

item.title: Remove muPDF and switch xpdf for better security
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
The other alternative is something that uses poppler as backend. qpdfview is the best UI and feature choice also opens DjVu and postscript formats. Doesn’t pull in a bunch DE specific deps.

Read full topic
item.source: Remove muPDF and switch xpdf for better security

item.title: Remove muPDF and switch xpdf for better security
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
github.com/Whonix/anon-meta-packages

remove mupdf 

due to unfixed security issues in Debian buster
https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-13290
https://forums.whonix.org/t/remove-mupdf-and-switch-xpdf-for-better-security/7884
by adrelanos on 11:30AM - 24 Oct 19 UTC
changed 1 files with 1 additions and 1 deletions.

Just remove the pdf reader for now. There is no rush to find a replacement for installation by default. Giving this time to look at various alternatives and entertain suggestion/discussion.

Read full topic

item.title: Remove muPDF and switch xpdf for better security
item.dc:creator: Patrick_mobile
item.description:
muPDF unfixed security issue in Debian buster.

https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-13290

sounds pretty bad.

Therefore replacement is needed.

//cc @HulaHoop

Read full topic
item.source: Remove muPDF and switch xpdf for better security

item.title: Remove muPDF and switch xpdf for better security
item.dc:creator: TNT_BOM_BOM
item.description:
madaidan:

Xpdf has had plenty of security vulnerabilities too

Too old , not happened as a package in debian. (according to the package history)

madaidan:

Mupdf also has a firejail profile. There is even a seccomp patch it can be used with.

Not intigrated with firetools.

usability sucks as i said before.

Read full topic
item.source: Remove muPDF and switch xpdf for better security

item.title: Remove muPDF and switch xpdf for better security
item.dc:creator: madaidan
item.description:
Xpdf has had plenty of security vulnerabilities too. Mupdf also has a firejail profile. There is even a seccomp patch it can be used with.

I don’t see why it should be switched.

Read full topic
